intro: Pelliciera rhizophorae var. benthamii, commonly known as the Benthams' pelliciera, is a rare flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its unique, fleshy, and often reddish stems. The plant typically grows in saline or brackish environments, adapting to the challenging conditions of mangrove ecosystems. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in terminal inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
